qas.question: How many Christian churches have been found in the Christian Petra?
When was the most important Byzantine church re-discovered?
What type of mosaics were present in the church discovered in 1990?
What century was the oldest known mosaic at the church discovered in 1990?
The scenes depicted on the mosaics were both native and what kind of mythological animals?

context: Mosaic art also flourished in Christian Petra where <a0_0>three<a0_0/> Byzantine churches were discovered. The most important one was uncovered <a1_0>in 1990<a1_0/>. It is known that the walls were also covered with golden glass mosaics but <a2_0>only the floor panels<a2_0/> survived as usual. The mosaic of the seasons in the southern aisle is from this first building period from the middle of <a3_0>the 5th<a3_0/> century. In the first half of the 6th century the mosaics of the northern aisle and the eastern end of the southern aisle were installed. They depict native as well as <a4_0>exotic<a4_0/> or mythological animals, and personifications of the Seasons, Ocean, Earth and Wisdom.
